# bayesplot

### Overview

**bayesplot** is an R package providing an extensive library of plotting
functions for use after fitting Bayesian models (typically with MCMC).
The plots created by **bayesplot** are ggplot objects, which means that
after a plot is created it can be further customized using various
functions from the **ggplot2** package.

Currently **bayesplot** offers a variety of plots of posterior draws,
visual MCMC diagnostics, graphical posterior (or prior) predictive
checking, and general plots of posterior (or prior) predictive
distributions.

The idea behind **bayesplot** is not only to provide convenient
functionality for users, but also a common set of functions that can be
easily used by developers working on a variety of packages for Bayesian
modeling, particularly (but not necessarily) those powered by
[**RStan**](https://mc-stan.org/rstan).

### Getting started

If you are just getting started with **bayesplot** we recommend starting
with the tutorial
[vignettes](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/articles/index.html), the
examples throughout the package
[documentation](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/index.html), and
the paper *Visualization in Bayesian workflow*:

- Gabry J, Simpson D, Vehtari A, Betancourt M, Gelman A (2019).
  Visualization in Bayesian workflow. *J. R. Stat. Soc. A*, 182:
  389-402. <doi:10.1111/rssa.12378>. ([journal
  version](https://rss.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/rssa.12378),
  [arXiv preprint](https://arxiv.org/abs/1709.01449), [code on
  GitHub](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jgabry/bayes-vis-paper))

### Resources

- [mc-stan.org/bayesplot](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot) (online
  documentation, vignettes)
- [Ask a question](https://discourse.mc-stan.org) (Stan Forums on
  Discourse)
- [Open an
  issue](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/issues)
  (GitHub issues for bug reports, feature requests)

### Contributing

We are always looking for new contributors! See
[CONTRIBUTING.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md)
for details and/or reach out via the issue tracker.

### Installation

- Install from CRAN:

``` r
install.packages("bayesplot")
```

- Install latest development version from GitHub (requires
  [devtools](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/hadley/devtools)
  package):

``` r
if (!require("devtools")) {
  install.packages("devtools")
}
devtools::install_github("stan-dev/bayesplot", dependencies = TRUE, build_vignettes = FALSE)
```

This installation wonâ€™t include the vignettes (they take some time to
build), but all of the vignettes are available online at
[mc-stan.org/bayesplot/articles](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/articles/).

### Examples

Some quick examples using MCMC draws obtained from the
[**rstanarm**](https://mc-stan.org/rstanarm) and
[**rstan**](https://mc-stan.org/rstann) packages.

``` r
library("bayesplot")
library("rstanarm")
library("ggplot2")

fit <- stan_glm(mpg ~ ., data = mtcars)
posterior <- as.matrix(fit)

plot_title <- ggtitle("Posterior distributions",
                      "with medians and 80% intervals")
mcmc_areas(posterior, 
           pars = c("cyl", "drat", "am", "wt"), 
           prob = 0.8) + plot_title
```

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/master/images/mcmc_areas-rstanarm.png)

``` r
color_scheme_set("red")
ppc_dens_overlay(y = fit$y, 
                 yrep = posterior_predict(fit, draws = 50))
```

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/master/images/ppc_dens_overlay-rstanarm.png)

``` r
# also works nicely with piping
library("dplyr")
color_scheme_set("brightblue")
fit %>% 
  posterior_predict(draws = 500) %>%
  ppc_stat_grouped(y = mtcars$mpg, 
                   group = mtcars$carb, 
                   stat = "median")
```

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/master/images/ppc_stat_grouped-rstanarm.png)

``` r
# with rstan demo model
library("rstan")
fit2 <- stan_demo("eight_schools", warmup = 300, iter = 700)
posterior2 <- extract(fit2, inc_warmup = TRUE, permuted = FALSE)

color_scheme_set("mix-blue-pink")
p <- mcmc_trace(posterior2,  pars = c("mu", "tau"), n_warmup = 300,
                facet_args = list(nrow = 2, labeller = label_parsed))
p + facet_text(size = 15)
```

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/master/images/mcmc_trace-rstan.png)

``` r
# scatter plot also showing divergences
color_scheme_set("darkgray")
mcmc_scatter(
  as.matrix(fit2),
  pars = c("tau", "theta[1]"), 
  np = nuts_params(fit2), 
  np_style = scatter_style_np(div_color = "green", div_alpha = 0.8)
)
```

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/master/images/mcmc_scatter-rstan.png)

``` r
color_scheme_set("red")
np <- nuts_params(fit2)
mcmc_nuts_energy(np) + ggtitle("NUTS Energy Diagnostic")
```

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/master/images/mcmc_nuts_energy-rstan.png)

``` r
# another example with rstanarm
color_scheme_set("purple")

fit <- stan_glmer(mpg ~ wt + (1|cyl), data = mtcars)
ppc_intervals(
  y = mtcars$mpg,
  yrep = posterior_predict(fit),
  x = mtcars$wt,
  prob = 0.5
) +
  labs(
    x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",
    y = "MPG",
    title = "50% posterior predictive intervals \nvs observed miles per gallon",
    subtitle = "by vehicle weight"
  ) +
  panel_bg(fill = "gray95", color = NA) +
  grid_lines(color = "white")
```

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/stan-dev/bayesplot/master/images/ppc_intervals-rstanarm.png)

# Package index

## Overview

Package overview

- [`bayesplot-package`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-package.md)
  [`bayesplot`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-package.md)
  :

  **bayesplot**: Plotting for Bayesian Models

## Aesthetics

Functions for setting the color scheme and ggplot theme used by
**bayesplot**. (Also see the separate **ggplot helpers** section below.)

- [`color_scheme_set()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-colors.md)
  [`color_scheme_get()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-colors.md)
  [`color_scheme_view()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-colors.md)
  :

  Set, get, or view **bayesplot** color schemes

- [`bayesplot_theme_get()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot_theme_get.md)
  [`bayesplot_theme_set()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot_theme_get.md)
  [`bayesplot_theme_update()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot_theme_get.md)
  [`bayesplot_theme_replace()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot_theme_get.md)
  :

  Get, set, and modify the active **bayesplot** theme

- [`theme_default()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/theme_default.md)
  :

  Default **bayesplot** plotting theme

## PPC

Functions for carrying out a wide variety of graphical model checks
based on comparing observed data to draws from the posterior or prior
predictive distribution.

- [`PPC-overview`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-overview.md)
  [`PPC`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-overview.md) :
  Graphical posterior predictive checking
- [`ppc_km_overlay()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-censoring.md)
  [`ppc_km_overlay_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-censoring.md)
  : PPC censoring
- [`ppc_bars()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-discrete.md)
  [`ppc_bars_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-discrete.md)
  [`ppc_rootogram()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-discrete.md)
  [`ppc_bars_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-discrete.md)
  : PPCs for discrete outcomes
- [`ppc_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_dens_overlay()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_dens_overlay_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_ecdf_overlay()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_ecdf_overlay_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_dens()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_hist()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_freqpoly()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_freqpoly_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_boxplot()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_dots()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_violin_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_pit_ecdf()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  [`ppc_pit_ecdf_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-distributions.md)
  : PPC distributions
- [`ppc_error_hist()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-errors.md)
  [`ppc_error_hist_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-errors.md)
  [`ppc_error_scatter()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-errors.md)
  [`ppc_error_scatter_avg()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-errors.md)
  [`ppc_error_scatter_avg_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-errors.md)
  [`ppc_error_scatter_avg_vs_x()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-errors.md)
  [`ppc_error_binned()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-errors.md)
  [`ppc_error_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-errors.md)
  : PPC errors
- [`ppc_intervals()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-intervals.md)
  [`ppc_intervals_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-intervals.md)
  [`ppc_ribbon()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-intervals.md)
  [`ppc_ribbon_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-intervals.md)
  [`ppc_intervals_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-intervals.md)
  [`ppc_ribbon_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-intervals.md)
  : PPC intervals
- [`ppc_loo_pit_overlay()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-loo.md)
  [`ppc_loo_pit_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-loo.md)
  [`ppc_loo_pit_qq()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-loo.md)
  [`ppc_loo_pit_ecdf()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-loo.md)
  [`ppc_loo_pit()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-loo.md)
  [`ppc_loo_intervals()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-loo.md)
  [`ppc_loo_ribbon()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-loo.md)
  : LOO predictive checks
- [`ppc_scatter()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-scatterplots.md)
  [`ppc_scatter_avg()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-scatterplots.md)
  [`ppc_scatter_avg_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-scatterplots.md)
  [`ppc_scatter_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-scatterplots.md)
  [`ppc_scatter_avg_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-scatterplots.md)
  : PPC scatterplots
- [`ppc_stat()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppc_stat_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppc_stat_freqpoly()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppc_stat_freqpoly_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppc_stat_2d()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppc_stat_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPC-test-statistics.md)
  : PPC test statistics
- [`pp_check()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/pp_check.md) :
  Posterior (or prior) predictive checks (S3 generic and default method)

## PPD

Functions for creating graphical displays of simulated data from the
posterior or prior predictive distribution (PPD). These plots are
essentially the same as the corresponding PPC plots but without
comparing to any observed data.

- [`PPD-overview`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-overview.md)
  [`PPD`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-overview.md) :
  Plots of posterior or prior predictive distributions
- [`ppd_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  [`ppd_dens_overlay()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  [`ppd_ecdf_overlay()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  [`ppd_dens()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  [`ppd_hist()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  [`ppd_dots()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  [`ppd_freqpoly()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  [`ppd_freqpoly_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  [`ppd_boxplot()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-distributions.md)
  : PPD distributions
- [`ppd_intervals()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-intervals.md)
  [`ppd_intervals_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-intervals.md)
  [`ppd_ribbon()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-intervals.md)
  [`ppd_ribbon_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-intervals.md)
  [`ppd_intervals_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-intervals.md)
  [`ppd_ribbon_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-intervals.md)
  : PPD intervals
- [`ppd_stat()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppd_stat_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppd_stat_freqpoly()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppd_stat_freqpoly_grouped()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppd_stat_2d()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-test-statistics.md)
  [`ppd_stat_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/PPD-test-statistics.md)
  : PPD test statistics

## MCMC

Functions for creating plots of MCMC draws of model parameters and
general MCMC diagnostics.

- [`MCMC-overview`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-overview.md)
  [`MCMC`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-overview.md) :
  Plots for Markov chain Monte Carlo simulations
- [`mcmc_rhat()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-diagnostics.md)
  [`mcmc_rhat_hist()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-diagnostics.md)
  [`mcmc_rhat_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-diagnostics.md)
  [`mcmc_neff()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-diagnostics.md)
  [`mcmc_neff_hist()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-diagnostics.md)
  [`mcmc_neff_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-diagnostics.md)
  [`mcmc_acf()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-diagnostics.md)
  [`mcmc_acf_bar()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-diagnostics.md)
  : General MCMC diagnostics
- [`mcmc_hist()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-distributions.md)
  [`mcmc_dens()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-distributions.md)
  [`mcmc_hist_by_chain()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-distributions.md)
  [`mcmc_dens_overlay()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-distributions.md)
  [`mcmc_dens_chains()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-distributions.md)
  [`mcmc_dens_chains_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-distributions.md)
  [`mcmc_violin()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-distributions.md)
  : Histograms and kernel density plots of MCMC draws
- [`mcmc_intervals()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-intervals.md)
  [`mcmc_areas()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-intervals.md)
  [`mcmc_areas_ridges()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-intervals.md)
  [`mcmc_intervals_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-intervals.md)
  [`mcmc_areas_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-intervals.md)
  [`mcmc_areas_ridges_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-intervals.md)
  : Plot interval estimates from MCMC draws
- [`mcmc_recover_intervals()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-recover.md)
  [`mcmc_recover_scatter()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-recover.md)
  [`mcmc_recover_hist()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-recover.md)
  : Compare MCMC estimates to "true" parameter values
- [`mcmc_scatter()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-scatterplots.md)
  [`mcmc_hex()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-scatterplots.md)
  [`mcmc_pairs()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-scatterplots.md)
  [`scatter_style_np()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-scatterplots.md)
  [`pairs_style_np()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-scatterplots.md)
  [`pairs_condition()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-scatterplots.md)
  : Scatterplots of MCMC draws
- [`mcmc_parcoord()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-parcoord.md)
  [`mcmc_parcoord_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-parcoord.md)
  [`parcoord_style_np()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-parcoord.md)
  : Parallel coordinates plot of MCMC draws
- [`mcmc_trace()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-traces.md)
  [`mcmc_trace_highlight()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-traces.md)
  [`trace_style_np()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-traces.md)
  [`mcmc_rank_overlay()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-traces.md)
  [`mcmc_rank_hist()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-traces.md)
  [`mcmc_rank_ecdf()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-traces.md)
  [`mcmc_trace_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-traces.md)
  : Trace and rank plots of MCMC draws
- [`mcmc_combo()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-combos.md)
  : Combination plots

## HMC/NUTS diagnostics

Functions for plotting diagnostics specific to Hamiltonian Monte Carlo
(HMC) and the No-U-Turn Sampler (NUTS). Some of the general MCMC
plotting functions
([`mcmc_parcoord()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-parcoord.md),
[`mcmc_pairs()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-scatterplots.md),
[`mcmc_scatter()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-scatterplots.md),
[`mcmc_trace()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-traces.md))
can also show HMC/NUTS diagnostic information if optional arguments are
specified, but the special functions below are *only* intended for use
with HMC/NUTS.

- [`mcmc_nuts_acceptance()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-nuts.md)
  [`mcmc_nuts_divergence()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-nuts.md)
  [`mcmc_nuts_stepsize()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-nuts.md)
  [`mcmc_nuts_treedepth()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-nuts.md)
  [`mcmc_nuts_energy()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/MCMC-nuts.md)
  : Diagnostic plots for the No-U-Turn-Sampler (NUTS)

## Tidy parameter selection for MCMC plots

Helper functions for tidy parameter selection and examples of using
**bayesplot** with [**dplyr**](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/).

- [`param_range()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/tidy-params.md)
  [`param_glue()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/tidy-params.md)
  : Tidy parameter selection

## ggplot helpers

Convenience functions for arranging multiple plots, adding features to
plots, and shortcuts for modifying individual ggplot theme elements.

- [`bayesplot_grid()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot_grid.md)
  : Arrange plots in a grid
- [`vline_at()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`hline_at()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`vline_0()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`hline_0()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`abline_01()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`lbub()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`legend_move()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`legend_none()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`legend_text()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`xaxis_title()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`xaxis_text()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`xaxis_ticks()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`yaxis_title()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`yaxis_text()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`yaxis_ticks()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`facet_text()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`facet_bg()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`panel_bg()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`plot_bg()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`grid_lines()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  [`overlay_function()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-helpers.md)
  : Convenience functions for adding or changing plot details

## Extractors

Functions extracting various quantities needed for plotting from
different types of fitted model objects.

- [`log_posterior()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-extractors.md)
  [`nuts_params()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-extractors.md)
  [`rhat()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-extractors.md)
  [`neff_ratio()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/bayesplot-extractors.md)
  : Extract quantities needed for plotting from model objects

## Miscellaneous

Functions for generating data for examples and listing available
plotting functions.

- [`example_mcmc_draws()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/example-data.md)
  [`example_yrep_draws()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/example-data.md)
  [`example_y_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/example-data.md)
  [`example_x_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/example-data.md)
  [`example_group_data()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/example-data.md)
  : Example draws to use in demonstrations and tests
- [`available_ppc()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/available_ppc.md)
  [`available_ppd()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/available_ppc.md)
  [`available_mcmc()`](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/reference/available_ppc.md)
  : Get or view the names of available plotting or data functions

# Articles

### Getting Started

These vignettes provide an introduction to visualizing MCMC draws and
diagnostics and performing graphical posterior predictive checks using
the **bayesplot** package.

- [Plotting MCMC draws using the bayesplot
  package](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/articles/plotting-mcmc-draws.md):
- [Visual MCMC diagnostics using the bayesplot
  package](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/articles/visual-mcmc-diagnostics.md):
- [Graphical posterior predictive checks using the bayesplot
  package](https://mc-stan.org/bayesplot/articles/graphical-ppcs.md):
